title: Panzer Knight
subtitle: A tank shooting game where you play as a German Tank Commander in Europe circa WWII.

sections.title: Overview
content: My main role was UI engineer in this project. I also contributed in implementing Steam SDK, dealing with performance issues. It was a great experience to work with a bigger team.

features.name: UI engineering
features.description: I made the UI function correctly.

features.name: Steam Unity SDK
features.description: Implemented the Steam SDK for the game.

sections.title: Development Process
content: I joined the project halfway. The original gameplay was trying to simulate the crew inside the tank, each soldier carrying out their own duties. The game changed to a more straight forward tank shooting game after some internal testplay feedback.

challenges.title: Challenge 1: Optimizing preformance
challenges.problem: Frame rate dropped significantly during intense encounters.
challenges.solution: Unity profiler was crucial to know where the problem was, one of the most interesting solution was sending the tank track simulation to gpu by a shader. Loading the map by chunk was another solution.

sections.title: What I Learned
items: Unity UI edit and sorting techniques
Building pipeline using Jenkins by scripts
Unity profiler is useful and not useful at the same time
